1.name: Lawrence of Arabia
1.description: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I in order to fight the Turks.

2.name: Dr. No
2.description: A resourceful British government agent seeks answers in a case involving the disappearance of a colleague and the disruption of the American space program.

3.name: The Longest Day
3.description: The events of D-Day, told on a grand scale from both the Allied and German points of view.

4.name: Lolita
4.description: A middle-aged college professor becomes infatuated with a fourteen-year-old nymphet.

5.name: To Kill a Mockingbird
5.description: Atticus Finch, a lawyer in the Depression-era South, defends a black man against an undeserved rape charge, and his children against prejudice.

6.name: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance
6.description: A senator, who became famous for killing a notorious outlaw, returns for the funeral of an old friend and tells the truth about his deed.

7.name: Seppuku
7.description: When a ronin requesting seppuku at a feudal lord's palace is told of the brutal suicide of another ronin who previously visited, he reveals how their pasts are intertwined - and in doing so challenges the clan's integrity.

8.name: Lonely Are the Brave
8.description: A fiercely independent cowboy gets himself locked up in prison to escape with an old friend.

9.name: The Manchurian Candidate
9.description: A former prisoner of war is brainwashed as an unwitting assassin for an international Communist conspiracy.

10.name: What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?
10.description: A former child star torments her paraplegic sister in their decaying Hollywood mansion.

11.name: How the West Was Won
11.description: A family saga covering several decades of Westward expansion in the nineteenth century - including the Gold Rush, the Civil War, and the building of the railroads.

12.name: Cape Fear
12.description: A lawyer's family is stalked by a man he once helped put in jail.

13.name: Sweet Bird of Youth
13.description: Drifter Chance Wayne returns to his hometown after many years of trying to make it in the movies. Arriving with him is a faded film star he picked up along the way, Alexandra Del Lago. ...                See full summary »

14.name: The Music Man
14.description: Harold Hill poses as a boys' band leader to con naive Iowa townsfolk.

15.name: Ivanovo detstvo
15.description: In WW2, twelve year old Soviet orphan Ivan Bondarev works for the Soviet army as a scout behind the German lines and strikes a friendship with three sympathetic Soviet officers.

16.name: Carnival of Souls
16.description: After a traumatic accident, a woman becomes drawn to a mysterious abandoned carnival.

17.name: The Miracle Worker
17.description: The story of Anne Sullivan's struggle to teach the blind and deaf Helen Keller how to communicate.

18.name: The L-Shaped Room
18.description: A single, pregnant woman moves into a London boarding house where she meets a group of fellow misfits.

19.name: Mutiny on the Bounty
19.description: In 1787, British ship Bounty leaves Portsmouth to bring a cargo of bread-fruit from Tahiti but the savage on-board conditions imposed by Captain Bligh trigger a mutiny led by officer Fletcher Christian.

20.name: El ángel exterminador
20.description: The guests at an upper-class dinner party find themselves unable to leave.

21.name: Knife in the Water
21.description: On their way to a sailing trip, an aging husband and wife invite along an emphatic young hitchhiker out of sheer patronization.

22.name: Jules et Jim
22.description: Decades of a love triangle concerning two friends and an impulsive woman.

23.name: The Loneliness of the Long Distance Runner
23.description: A juvenile offender (Sir Tom Courtenay) at a tough reform school impresses its Governor (Sir Michael Redgrave) with his running ability and is encouraged to compete in an upcoming race, but faces ridicule from his peers.

24.name: Hatari!
24.description: A group of men trap wild animals in Africa and sell them to zoos before the arrival of a female wildlife photographer threatens to change their ways.

25.name: Two Weeks in Another Town
25.description: After spending three years in an asylum, a washed-up actor views a minor assignment from his old director in Rome as a chance for personal and professional redemption.

26.name: Cléo de 5 à 7
26.description: Cleo, a singer and hypochondriac, becomes increasingly worried that she might have cancer while awaiting test results from her doctor.

27.name: Tales of Terror
27.description: Three tales of terror involve a grieving widower and the daughter he abandoned; a drunkard and his wife's black cat; and a hypnotist who prolongs the moment of a man's death.

28.name: Kingu Kongu tai Gojira
28.description: A newspaper and television station funded by a pharmaceutical company want a sensation, which happens to be the discovery of King Kong on an island. He is captured and brought to Japan, where he escapes from captivity and battles Godzilla.

29.name: Vivre sa vie: Film en douze tableaux
29.description: Twelve episodic tales in the life of a Parisian woman and her slow descent into prostitution.

30.name: Le procès
30.description: An unassuming office worker is arrested and stands trial, but he is never made aware of his charges.

31.name: Sanjuro
31.description: A crafty samurai helps a young man and his fellow clansmen save his uncle, who has been framed and imprisoned by a corrupt superintendent.

32.name: Days of Wine and Roses
32.description: An alcoholic marries a young woman, who he systematically addicts to booze, so they can share his "passion" together.

33.name: L'eclisse
33.description: A young woman meets a vital young man, but their love affair is doomed because of the man's materialistic nature.

34.name: Boccaccio '70
34.description: Inspired by Boccaccio's novellas, each episode focuses on sex, love and seduction in Italy's 1960s, an era of economic growth and major cultural changes.

35.name: Eegah
35.description: Teenagers stumble across a prehistoric caveman, who goes on a rampage.

36.name: Ride the High Country
36.description: An ex-union soldier is hired to transport gold from a mining community through dangerous territory. But what he doesn't realize is that his partner and old friend is plotting to double-cross him.

37.name: Taras Bulba
37.description: In the 16th century Ukraine, the Polish overlords and the Cossacks fight for control of the land but frequent Turkish invasions force them to unite against the common Turkish foe.

38.name: The Brain That Wouldn't Die
38.description: A doctor experimenting with transplant techniques keeps his girlfriend's head alive when she is decapitated in a car crash, then goes hunting for a new body.

39.name: The 300 Spartans
39.description: A small Army of Greeks spearheaded by three hundred Spartans do battle with the whole invading Persian Army.

40.name: Birdman of Alcatraz
40.description: A surly convicted murderer held in permanent isolation redeems himself when he becomes a renowned bird expert.

41.name: That Touch of Mink
41.description: A rich businessman and a young woman are attracted to each other, but he only wants an affair while she wants to save herself for marriage.

42.name: Girls! Girls! Girls!
42.description: When he finds out his boss is retiring to Arizona, a sailor has to find a way to buy the Westwind, a boat that he and his father built. He is also caught between two women: insensitive club singer Robin and sweet Laurel.

43.name: Gypsy
43.description: Based on the Broadway hit about the life and times of burlesque dancer Gypsy Rose Lee and her aggressive stage mother, Mama Rose.

44.name: Il sorpasso
44.description: An impulsive braggart takes a shy law student for a two-day ride through the Roman and Tuscany countries.

45.name: Advise & Consent
45.description: Senate investigation into the President's newly nominated Secretary of State, gives light to a secret from the past, which may not only ruin the candidate, but the President's character as well.

46.name: Geronimo
46.description: In 1880s Arizona, General Crook and his troops are trying to subdue the last tribe of Apache led by Geronimo.

47.name: Tender Is the Night
47.description: A Psychiatrist and his life with a patient he helped to recover.

48.name: Long Day's Journey Into Night
48.description: At the end of a long and hot summer day, members of one family gather in a large house. Everyone has something painful and offensive to say, and their silence is even worse.

49.name: Walk on the Wild Side
49.description: A man arrives in New Orleans searching for his former girlfriend, an artist who now works in a bordello.

50.name: The Chapman Report
50.description: Based on the best-selling novel by Irving Wallace that was inspired by the Kinsey Report on the sexual mores of suburban women, the film follows the personal (read sexual) lives of four ...                See full summary »
